Abstract: This review explores cutting-edge nanotechnologies for targeted drug delivery to the lymphatic system, focusing on physiology-informed approaches. We discuss recent advancements in bioengineering and immunoengineering that leverage the unique properties of nanomaterials to enhance lymph node-specific drug delivery. The potential of these innovative strategies to revolutionize treatments for lymphatic disorders and improve immunotherapies is examined, highlighting the intersection of biomaterials science and targeted delivery systems.
